description: Borrowed from Hindi पालकी (pālkī), from Sanskrit पल्यङ्क (palyaṅka). The same origin as palanquin.

entries.meaning: (South Asia, now chiefly historical) A litter or palanquin. [from 17th c.]
examples: The music had accompanied her as she was carried, in a palki, from the riverbank to the threshold of her new home  […]
